source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk1
evidence_span: Proton irradiation creep and in-pile creep and growth tests have been conducted on specimens cut from the same rolled and annealed Zircaloy-2 plate.
test_type: proton irradiation creep, in-pile creep and growth

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk1
evidence_span: Over the range studied the stress and damage rate exponents were unity and the temperature dependence was best described with a $q$ -value of 0.5.
property_name: stress exponent, damage rate exponent, temperature dependence

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk1
evidence_span: Longitudinal and transverse specimens exhibited a degree of creep anisotropy.

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk1
evidence_span: Additional specimens were reactor preirradiated to a dose of 1.0 dpa and tested in the ion accelerator.

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk1
evidence_span: The Harwell Proton Irradiation Creep facility, installed on the 6 MeV Van de Graaff accelerator, has proved successful n the studyoradiatinnduced deformation in a range of materials [15].

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk1

evidence_span: Specimens were preoxidized in situ for $0 . 5 \ \mathrm { h }$ at ${ \bf 7 2 3 ~ K }$ since temperature stability during tests depended directly upon the surface oxide emissivity remaining constant.

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk2
evidence_span: A series of specimens was preirradiated to a dose of about I dpa in the inreactor growth rig

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk2
evidence_span: Friction in the system was measured by substituting a slave load cell for the specimen, which indicated an absolute error of $\pm 5 \mathbb { M P a }$ in the applied stress.

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk2
evidence_span: The load-cell output can be controlled to better than $\pm 1 \ \pm \mathsf { P a }$ .

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk2
evidence_span: The indicated temperature could be maintained within about $\pm 2 \textbf { K }$ under normal operating conditions.

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk2
evidence_span: This led to an absolute uncertainty of $\pm 7 \textbf { K }$ in the specimen temperature

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_025_chunk2
